description: From Middle English idely, ydelly, idelliche, from Old English īdellīċe, equivalent to idle +‎ -ly.

adverbs.description: idly (comparative more idly, superlative most idly)

entries.meaning: Without specific purpose, intent or effort. [from 9th c.]
examples: I idly played with the paper, not even realizing I was folding it into a paper airplane.
